ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Patch Message
ygData.msgSnippet: I meant total subscribers to everquest, not posters on some message board. As shown by Atonal s posting of 74 bards at peak time on Xegony, this is far less
ygData.messageBody:
I meant total subscribers to everquest, not posters on some message board.
As shown by Atonal's posting of 74 bards at peak time on Xegony, this is
far less than 5% of the people playing.

This game has a little bit of something for everyone, and therefore should be
balanced as such. What's the percentage of people who go into Veeshans
Peak or Sleepers Tomb? Does that mean that those zones are insignificant?
Not for the people who do go into them.

My argument still stands. It is pretty narrow minded to say that ''those people
are a small minority and thus don't matter''. It is pretty easy to say when you aren't
on of ''those people''. Like I said before, bards are less than 5% of the total peak
populations on servers, yet, because you are one of them, they aren't one of ''very,
very, very, tiny minority'', that you find it easy to call other folks?

note: I decided to take your advice and go to eqvault and see how many players were
playing pvp vs regular. Even counting test and chat as part of the total, the number
of players on pvp were 6.92152% of the total number of players on line currently. Slightly
more than your 5% number. Almost double the percentage of bards playing on peak
on xegony. So now who is the very very very tiny minority???


At 10:34 AM 2/26/01 -0700, you wrote:
>Only a fool would make the argument that all bards are posted here. That is
>so totally ludicrous as to almost be unanswerable if it were not so
>offensive.
>
>Anyone can see that there are three pvp servers, each on the lower end of
>the population base and easily determine how many people at any one time are
>playing in a potential pvp environment. Even if those people were all
>playing pvp all the time and never playing pve, their number would still be
>insignificant compared to the overall number of players.
>
>Get a clue, this is NOT a pvp game except for a very, very, very, tiny
>minority.
